response.overview: " Created at the location where the work was to be exhibited, 'being-here' is named after Gaston Bachelard's notion of "being-there". A dancer is both "here"—at the New Zealand Film Archive in Wellington—and "there", represented visually as part of the video. She weaves through the frame, physically exploring camera space/time and interacting with the stage-like architecture and the unknowingly participating passersby." - Artist's statement  When this work was exhibited on Masons Screen, Wellington, Aotearoa, its title was amended for the new context to being-(t)here.
response.title: Being-(t)here
